file_content.text: Yes--yes! I have been waiting for you. I felt your movements in the Force, and they stirred me from my nightmare.
I am still too weak to leave, but I knew if I made myself enough of a nuisance, you would eventually come.
The Sith throw flesh endlessly at what they cannot control. And here you are, blood of my blood. Here you are.
You seem as if you were expecting me.
Didn't know I was so popular.
I have come to humble myself in your presence, oh great one.
I bow before you, my lord.
What are you talking about?
Blood of my blood?
Ah, you don't know me.
Has our family fallen so far that the son of my sons does not know the name of Kallig, the name so long revered in the annals of the Sith?
Has our family fallen so far that the daughter of my daughters does not know the name of Kallig, the name so long revered in the annals of the Sith?
You are my descendant--by how many generations, I do not know--but know this: Your strength in the Force has awakened me from my stupor.
What do you mean I awakened you?
I don't understand.
Just get to the point.
This is nuts.
Do not mock me, child. You do not even begin to understand who you are dealing with.
When the weaklings of this planet trespassed my tomb, I rose, resuming my former life. This temple became my kingdom, and I was once more a Lord of the Sith.
But when you first grasped the hilt of your lightsaber, I knew my hour had come and gone--that your strength, not mine, would return our family to glory.
I'm going to return our family to glory?
What?
Our family was torn from greatness, crushed by the treachery of another--a man named Tulak Hord.
But I'm a former slave!
I'm not from a Sith family!
That is my shame. I was once one of the greatest Lords of the Sith. If I'd been wiser, I could have secured my family's greatness.
But I let down my guard and was betrayed by a man called Tulak Hord, whom I trusted as a friend.
In restoring our bloodline to glory, you must not make the same mistake. Treachery is the Sith's endless game--you must win it.
Just because you were betrayed doesn't mean I will be.
You're paranoid.
Ah, such foolish innocence. I had the same--I lived in the same naive, foolish innocence. And now....
Look around you at my loyal subjects. See how they betray and murder each other, masters and apprentices alike.
Then I will win.
I couldn't care less about our "bloodline."
Your bloodline, not mine.
Fool! You think that you have risen to power in spite of your nothingness, but your nothingness must have had a purpose.
And when that purpose is exhausted, you will go back to being nothing.
Beware your master, beware your apprentice. Never be taken by surprise. Do these things, and you will be unstoppable.
No surprises. Got it.
I'll watch out.
My master would never betray me.
I don't believe you.
So you think. But the time will come--your master will start to do and say things you never expected to see or hear.
You're an idiot.
I am guilty on both charges. Do not make my mistakes.
But you have not come to see me; you have come for the artifact I managed to wrest from Tulak Hord before he died.
Take the artifact, but be careful--I know not what it does. Only that betrayal follows it everywhere.
It wouldn't be worth taking otherwise.
I like the sound of that.
Just keep your eyes open.
When betrayal shows up, I'll kill it.
I fear nothing.
If only all things were so simple. Keep your eyes open.
Don't worry.
I hunger for the day when our power will be restored. We will meet again.
But my mother was a Jedi!
Our family?
But my father was a Jedi!
Our family?
But my mother was a smuggler!
Our family?
But my father was a smuggler!
Our family?
But my father was a Sith!
Our family?
But my mother was a Sith!
Our family?
So it has been off and on for generations--our family rises again, only to be put down.
I should've secured our greatness. Instead I let myself be betrayed--by a man called Tulak Hord, by a friend.
And yet you speak as if alive. I would serve my master well to correct that.
But my mother was a Republic trooper!
Our family?
But my father was a Republic trooper!
Our family?
But my mother was an Imperial spy!
Our family?
But my father was an Imperial spy!
Our family?
But my mother was a bounty hunter!
Our family?
But my father was a bounty hunter!
Our family?
But my mother wasn't Sith!
Our family?
But my father wasn't Sith!
Our family?
Yes, our family has lost its way. Ever since Tulak Hord betrayed and murdered me on this very planet.
Tell me where Tulak Hord's artifact is.
Just give me what I want.
Don't speak of it. Wretched thing. Its master murdered me and laid me to rest in this catacomb.
And it is there you should have stayed, weak one. I would serve my master well to devour you a second time.
Ha! Your master is dead, beast. You serve the child of Kallig now. Flesh of my flesh, you should teach your servant to obey.
I will deal with him as I see fit.
That's not your call.
Fair enough. I only caution you not to take obedience for granted.
I defeated him once. I can control him.
I'm not worried.
Such confidence. Such pride.
Do not interrupt again or there will be no feeding for you for a long time.
Fall in line, Khem.
Of course... my master.
Good. You must not take obedience for granted.
Still, if you came to possess Tulak Hord's power--that could be very useful indeed. But you must be careful.
Leave me. I have plans to make, a kingdom to rule!
